info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 3:43AM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Missoula and west central Powell Counties through 415 AM MDT... At 340 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles south of Seeley Lake, or 26 miles northwest of Drummond, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ovando, Seeley Lake, Woodworth, and Clearwater. This includes the following highways... Highway 83 between mile markers 0 and 11. Highway 200 E between mile markers 24 and 50. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
